comments: The 22-digit cycle 1,0,1,4,4,9,2,7,5,3,6,2,3,1,8,8,4,0,5,7,9,7 in this sequence and the others based on sixty-ninths, gives the successive digits of the smallest integer which is multiplied by seven when the final digit is moved from the right hand end to the left hand end. - _Ian Duff_, Jan 09 2009
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
